text: Vos to Venezuela we're here in Venezuela
we're in one of the communes and uh
we've been speaking to the locals and
what they tell us is that they have
built 45 homes ever since the commune
acceleration process started and that
it's completely revamped the
neighborhood uh and it's uh enhanced the
social fabric of the community and I
mean these communities seem very class
conscious one of the things that that we
see all over the place are Palestinian
Flags uh items and images that identify
with the revolution
not just here with the Venezuela but
portraits of J and many other
revolutionaries from around the world
and one of the things that they're
saying especially the leaders is that uh
you know the basis of bolivarian
socialism is here it's in these communes
where millions of people live and
experience almost uh In the Flesh in in
their life's World in their leban world
what it is like to to to live a
communist existence and it's also it's
not just cultural it's also in terms of
people's social welfare these communes
are the initiatives of local people who
are cooperating with the authorities of
the Venezuelan state to build up kind of
autonomous and Sovereign bases of
popular control these communes are home
to not just houses which are owned by
the Venezuelan people they're not rented
out they're owned by the people and in
addition to that they have medical
assistance food sports and entertainment
there's a giant pool that we just
visited soccer stadium things that bring
the community together um so we can see
the results of the bolivarian Revolution
have been not just to instill people of
class Consciousness at a basic local
level but also giving them the concrete
results of what a socialist society
looks like yeah in America we're lied to
we're told that socialism means you know
the government coming in taking your
toothbrush you're not owning anything
but this is the opposite in the US
people in our generation have no hope
for owning homes of their own but here
in Venezuela even with the the
Strangling blockade and the hybrid War
for the US is waging against it we're
seeing we're seeing people own their
basic necessities and have a dignified
life and that is what the revolution has
provided and I think that's one of the
most honorable things that is not
usually spoken of these people have been
dignified by the revolution that they
themselves are a part of constructing so
despite the blockade despite the
economic hardships imposed by
imperialism bolivarian socialism lives
on and the people here are carrying the
legacy of Hugo shavez and the United
Socialist Party of Venezuela indeed and
we have a lot to learn as Americans yes
keep you updated the next
